newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold static in quiet trade.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold static in quiet trade.

text.p: Traded volume on the Istanbul gold exchange shrank to 1,370 kilos on Thursday from Wednesday's 2,230 kilos as traders were sidelined amid uncertainty over price trends, dealers said.
Gold closed very little changed at $348.60 an ounce from $348.00 on Wednesday and unchanged at 1,424,000 lira per gram.
European markets were at a standstill ahead of the Easter holiday.

"What trade there was today was due to the banks registering their gold (imports) on the exchange. Traders were reluctant to enter the market because of uncertainty about the direction of prices," one dealer said.
Of the day's turnover, 695 kilos changed hands in the morning session.
Some 58.4 percent of trade was in lira terms.
